tasks.task: Conduct a survey of farm equipment dealers to gauge their concerns about new engine technologies and gather suggestions for easing those concerns.
subtasks: Contact farm equipment dealers and request their input on new engine technologies.
Distribute a survey targeting farm equipment dealers to collect their opinions on EGR and SCR technologies for compliance with Tier 4 interim requirements.
Follow up with a similar survey a year later to track changes in dealers' perceptions and experiences.
Analyze the results of the surveys, focusing on common themes and dealer suggestions.

tasks.task: Address dealers' frustration with conflicting manufacturer claims regarding new engine technologies.
subtasks: Investigate the sources of confusion among farmers when evaluating EGR and SCR technology benefits.
Compile a list of contradictory claims made by manufacturers and assess their validity.
Prepare educational materials, including side-by-side performance tests and real-world comparisons, to clarify the facts about different engine technologies.
Develop a marketing strategy to promote accurate information about EGR and SCR technologies to farmers.

tasks.task: Enhance dealer support in managing customer concerns about new engine technologies.
subtasks: Train dealers on key points of each engine technology to overcome confusion and provide accurate information.
Encourage dealers to compare competitor products thoroughly and present balanced information to customers.
Recommend extending warranties on new equipment as a confidence-building measure, though acknowledging market realities.

tasks.task: Conduct a survey of farm equipment dealers to gauge their concerns about new engine technologies.
Address dealers' frustration with conflicting manufacturer claims regarding new engine technologies.
Enhance dealer support in managing customer concerns about new engine technologies.
